content.question: To estimate the size of a typical housing unit in a certain town, a sociologist plans to use a cluster sampling method to gather data. Which of the following describes a cluster sampling method?

choices.label: Randomly select a certain number of housing units in the town.
Divide all housing units into three groups: small, medium, and large. Then randomly select a certain number from each group.
Divide the town into nonoverlapping regions. Randomly select from the nonoverlapping regions, and select all housing units in those regions.
Obtain a listing of all housing units currently for sale in the town, and use the size information given in the listing.
Obtain the records kept by the town of all housing units in the town, and use the information in those records.

content.answer: Divide the town into nonoverlapping regions. Randomly select from the nonoverlapping regions, and select all housing units in those regions.

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Describe an appropriate method for gathering and representing data.
